result.execSummary:
The defendant Minerva Andrade was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $500.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Fine in the amount of $79.00 is to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Mandatory DNA Surcharge - Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for the Fine.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:45 PM: Defendant Minerva Andrade in court with attorney Katena Roberts-Turner.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement on resolution recited by DA.  SPD and Def confirm resolution.    Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea OAR 1: NC   Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Statement by Def: None offered.   The Court:  Accepts resolution and orders $100 Fine plus costs - $500 to be applied - 60 DTP or PP on any balance.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given.
State's
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 5, 2017 at 01:45 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Katena Roberts-Turner in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel has not yet connected with her client on offer extended.  Believes offer will be accepted.  P/S Scheduled as requested.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 5, 2017 at 01:45 pm.
Corrected Status conference on July 27, 2017 at 09:55 am.
Status conference on July 17, 2017 at 09:55 am.

Case Called @ 3:07 PM: Defendant Minerva Andrade in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms with Defendant after conversing that she does not need Interpreter services.  Def states she was found eligible for SPD services - confirmed last Friday.  Def instructed to follow up with SPD to find out who consel will be.  Tele STC scheduled to insure counsel has been appointed.  Status conference scheduled for July 17, 2017 at 09:55 am.
Status conference on July 11, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Minerva Andrade in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions Defendant on the status of her counsel.  Defendant states she has spoken with SPD in person when she was in jail - she states the SPD office has not given her any indication on counsel.  Court again directs Defendant that she needs to contact SPD for eligibility process.  SPD Info given to Def directly.  STC adjourned for eligibility.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant appears via video from the WC Jail.

Case called @ 1:03 p.m. Defendant Minerva Andrade in court, in custody, appears via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant is wishing to have counsel. Referred to SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $250 - $500 Cash Bond. Court orders $500 Cash Bond.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2017 at 09:25 am.

Case Called @ 3:19 PM: Defendant Minerva Andrade not in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Based upon nonappearance, Arrest Warrant Authorized with Statewide Extradition.  Court orders forfeiture of the $250 Cash Bond previously posted.    Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Default ordered as to companion 15TR-2344.
